div.p: This entry applies across the Orlando Project: stylistic practice issues around abbreviations.

ul.li: Names of entry subjects can be abbreviated within the Biography and Writing documents to the initial capitals used in the Standard Name. Jane Austen > JA, Marie-Catherine d’Aulnoy > MCA.

Do not punctuate abbreviations with periods if abbreviation ends with the same letter as the word. For example, use Mr or Mrs or Dr (no period) but Prof. and the Rev. (periods). Note that we use the definite article with the Rev.
Do not abbreviate Street, Avenue, Boulevard, etc. Spell out names in full.
Do not abbreviate Mount to Mt. Abbreviate "Saint" to "St" in placenames; for example, use "St Tropez" and not "Saint Tropez".

Do NOT abbreviate names of regions unless you have used the reg attribute on Region to specify the region’s full name. When you encounter words or phrases such as member of parliament, per annum, ounces, or pounds, please spell them out.
Do not use abbreviations. We want to use symbols only for dollars, British sterling, and the ampersand (where necessary, e.g. In quoting from ms). These should be included as entity references.
